name: Freya Renee
text:
I was very disappointed with my encounter here, the staff are awful.
I was referred by my dermatologist to have an X-ray done. I do not have insurance but was fully prepared to pay out of pocket.
The admissions clerk made a spectacle out of me not having insurance, getting her boss to see if they would see me or refuse me service.
Her boss tells me I need to get the specific code so she can look it up, which is literally her job.
She has all of my information and the dermatologist information in front of her and she tells me I have to do it myself, call her for a price, and then come back to get the X-ray.
This entire exchange was very loud and unnecessary, I left in tears.

name: Lisa Marie
text: DO NOT COME HERE FOR AN EMERGENCY. We were passing through and a family member had a serious seizure nearby. He was puking in the waiting room and no one cleaned it up. They said "housekeeping is gone for the day." The nurse wasn't wearing scrubs or a mask. Patient was barely able to communicate and they kicked his spouse out of the exam room. They attempted to kick the spouse out of the hospital completely, saying "no visitors." Refused to let family communicate with patient to gauge his decision-making abilities and kept saying he was fine, even though they had to come out to the waiting room to ask about meds and medical conditions because he couldn't communicate this information!! Place is filthy, please Alabama do something about your rural healthcare.

When I was there the hospital leaders were serving nachos to the employees. I think this reflects the caring culture of the organization.

text: Although we had a 3 hour visit, the staff was  phenomenal!!!! We had the sweetest nurses that actually took the time to talk to my children to keep from being scared and to help them feel better about our visit. My boys we’re running high fever and hurting all over, the staff immediately tested them. Our nurse was very gentle with my children during the nose and throat swabs that my 4 and 7 yr old didn’t even cry or flinch.  They ended up having the flu and one of our nurses even brought them suckers. All during this time they were serving 6 other patients for way more serious conditions. It meant so much to me that even though they were working under a lot of stress they still treated my children like their pediatrician would have.

text: Dr. Burns has been my doctor for over 10 years.  He is to the point and honest with you about YOUR problems. Don't expect him to sugar coat anything.  He will explain it to you in terms you can understand and will not be typing away on some tablet making you feel like you are some ignorant person.  He respects you and truly wants to see you get better.  His new facility is so much nicer than his previous office at the hospital.  The nurses are also just great and make you feel right at home.  Seeing a specialist can sometimes be stressful but Dr. Burns and staff set me at ease and I owe him a great amount of thanks.

name: S.B. S.
text: As a new patient I found Dr. Burns to be very personable, professional and knowledgeable.  He thoroughly explained the testing procedures and results of examinations to effectively diagnose and treat my cardiac issues.  His staff went out of their way to be accommodative and friendly even in the midst of an unprecedented global pandemic.  I am very glad I chose Dr. Burns over the big-box corporate providers in the Huntsville area.

name: pilotcoolbiz
text: I have been seeing Dr. Burns for years. He is one of the leading, if not the best Cardiologists in Huntsville. He has always gone the extra mile to work me into the schedule and has taken excellent care of me. He genuinely cares about, and for his patients, one and all. He takes the time to explain results of tests in a manner that is understandable to lay vocabularies such as mine. He is probably the most accomplished person I have ever met. His background in medicine is vast and he continues to receive accolades for recent accomplishments. He is also an accomplished pilot of both airplanes and helicopters. Just an all around good guy. Not only is Dr. Burns kind and attentive to his patients needs, so are all of his office staff. Best doctor I have ever had, bar none.

name: Luke Smith
text: I have known Dr. Burns for many years as a friend and fellow aviator. Although I myself have had the blessing of good health, I have long been aware of Dr. Burns exceedingly fine reputation as a cardiologist. I have always known that if I should ever have an issue with my heart, he would be the only doctor I would trust to sort things out.  Recently, while flying a corporate jet trip in Asia, I needed to renew my FAA Medical.  During the appointment, some questions arose with my EKG.  I immediately contacted Dr. Burns and despite the 12 hour time difference he took my call and immediately began the process of understanding the situation and working to resolve it.  Despite not feeling ill, nor having any symptoms, I was told I would need an expanded cardiac evaluation right away in order to maintain my license to fly.  Within 48 hours I was on a flight from Hong Kong to Huntsville.  Dr. Burns worked me into his schedule, reviewed my FAA medical records from the preceding 7 years and performed a thorough evaluation to find out what might be going on with me.  Fortunately,  the tests revealed I am in good health but without Dr. Burns' help I would most likely have found myself out of my profession for months or even years, working through a very challenging system to return to work.  Instead, through his thoughtful and meticulous care, I was able to return to work with a clean bill of health and a freshly renewed Medical, a mere 5 days from the start of the entire adventure.   in addition to helping me to keep my profession and livelihood intact, Dr. Burns educated and redirected my thoughts on my health in a much more positive direction.  If you have a heart issue, Dr. Burns is the one you want to help you, even if you have to travel half way around the world.

name: Carole Hollis
text:
I have always been a very active person, enjoying all outdoor activities.  My legs started to tire while hiking and progressed to swelling and needing to elevate them during my work day.  I was afraid that I would no longer be able to do the things I love but Dr Naidu gave me hope.  We did an ultrasound and found that the valves in  my leg veins were leaking and not pumping the blood properly.  He was very confident that he could help me.  I was hesitant to have a procedure so I opted to have it done on one leg and if it showed improvement, I would have the other leg done.
All I can say is what a miracle!  I had immediate relief!  When I walked out of his office, it was as if someone had taken a 5lb. ankle weight off of my leg!  No down time, no repercussions.  I was walking and working in the yard the next day!  Needless to say, I had the other leg done two weeks later and I am completely satisfied.
I am now back to working a full day without wearing compression hose and able to hike after work.  I do not have to give up my active lifestyle and that makes me happy!
If you have swelling, leg pain or restrictive movement in your legs are ankles, you should give him a call.  I promise you will not regret it!

text: I had gotten to the point, I spent most of my time sitting.  My legs were weak, restless, and they hurt. Dr. Naidu is very experienced, made the procedures as comfortable as possible and finished them in a timely fashion,  After a few months I have experienced complete relief of my symptoms, I'm back to walking and climbing stairs without problem.  As a bonus and thanks to being more active, I have lost 14 lbs.  I would recommend Dr. Naidu and his knowledgeable staff to anyone with leg problems.  Don't put it off, see Dr. Naidu, keep an open mind, and feel better.

name: Stanford Smith
text:
Dr. Naidu has helped me more than I can adequately state. At the time of being referred to his office for my leg issues I weighed around 275 pounds and was not taking good care of myself at all. During the course of the treatments I learned I had turned myself into a Type 2 diabetic with a glucose level of 289 and an a1c of 13.1. I was put on Metformin as a starting treatment, with the ominous prospect of giving myself insulin injections if my condition didn't improve.

I don't know about you folks, but I don't like needles. I made a total lifestyle change; I placed myself on a 1200-calorie, low-sugar (under 25 grams a day), low-carb (under 100 grams a day) diet, got back into a regular workout regimen, and did what my medical staff recommended. The condition of my legs improved vastly from the laser treatments. Three months after I began taking Metformin my prescription was cut from two tablets a day to one, and after six months I no longer needed it. Monitoring my sugar three times daily my glucose averages dropped to below 100 with an a1c in the mid-fives. My weight bottomed out at 198. You can either have a pity party for yourself and keep doing all the wrong things, or you can make the changes you need and improve yourself. It can be done; I'm the proof.

I thank Dr. Naidu and his staff both past and present for all their help in getting me to this point in my health. I am 48 years old and in my best shape since my twenties. I eat heathier than I ever have, work out 4 to 5 times a week, and sleep better. My blood pressure is excellent and all my levels are where they need to be. I'm happy with where I am, and yet I still feel I haven't peaked yet.

I would recommend Dr. Ajit Naidu and Cardiovascular Institute of the Shoals to anyone.

text: I was seen at the chest pain clinic in the heart center and was given very good care. I came in to the front desk window and told her I was having pains in my chest. I didnt have to worry about doing paperwork until later when I was feeling better. I have a appointment to come back tomorrow to do a test on a treadmill to be sure my heart is good.

name: Malik P
text: I went to the Heart Center’s Urgent Care Clinic. I would rate my experience a 0 if I had the option. I had high hopes for my experience because I heard such great things. I just knew I was going to get the same experience.Well it didn’t happen for me. I went to the heart urgent care clinic hoping to receive help because I had severe chest and arm pain on Wednesday and I was still having some chest discomfort. The receptionist and the woman who took my initial vitals and a EKG were very kind. However my experience with the nurse practitioner Tracy was less desirable. Tracy asked where I lived and I told her. She suggested I may want to find a closer physician to where I lived. That should have been my first sign to RUN !  Then I spoke to Tracy about my current issues that she quickly dismissed as being associated with my heart despite the fact that my ekg that was done at the beginning of my visit was abnormal. Tracy said everyone has abnormal Ekg’s. Tracy never seemed to truly listen to my problems and she was dismissive of everything I said. I felt like my voice and my concerns were not heard. So, I asked what was wrong with me. Tracy initially said she wasn’t sure but she knew it wasn’t my heart and suggested I do stretches. Tracy said she was going to look at the results of my blood work that was done initially and come back to speak with me. Problem is , Tracy never came back. Tracy sent the poor receptionist to speak with me and give me my results and to tell me that I needed to schedule to come back for a stress test later this month but I didn’t need to be in a hurry to do it.  The receptionist had a boot on her foot and was barely walking herself. I asked the receptionist to ask Tracy what did she suggest about my chest discomfort. The poor receptionist had to walk again and find Tracy. At this point, Tracy did not come directly back to speak with me. I ended up walking out of the patient room and into the waiting area to patiently wait to speak with the receptionist  once she got off the phone. At this point, Tracy came out in the waiting area to speak with me. I asked Tracy about my continued chest discomfort. Tracy told me that I could have pulled a muscle and I needed to take ibuprofen with every meal. Tracy then said it could be my esophagus or  just from standing up. Basically, she had no answers for me. Total waste of time and money. They don’t care about you. If you want to live, go somewhere else.

name: Janette Perry
text:
The doctor we see is wonderful. But this is the poorest run Dr. Office we go to. My aged Mother has had cancer and has heart problems so we see several Doctors. This office will tell us that they will contact us when it is closer to time for the next visit. This visit is due in Feb. and it is now Feb. I have called for an apt. I have not heard back. She is now running out of her medication and again I have called for it but have not gotten a call back. In the past I have had to call several times with no return calls. I would just expect that a office connected to Huntsville Hospital would be better run. The last time after several calls I finally went in and parked myself in their office until I could get confirmation that her medication would be called in. It took over an hour of waiting.  Another thing I have had problems with in the past was getting in when my Mother felt her heart was again out of rhythm. I know they are busy but you hate to go to the hospital to find out if she is in trouble. This Heart center has people that run a heart Cardiogram every time we go in so why can't they have a room set up for people that just need to make sure they are ok if they feel they are having problem? Most people would rather have a Doctor visit bill as apposed to a hospital bill just to get a Cardiogram run. There are a lot of people out there that can't afford the hospital bill, but with insurance could get to the Doctor.
Again we love the Doctor we see but feel the heart center needs better management.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention, Ms. Perry. We're very sorry that you have had trouble getting your mother's appointments scheduled. We have shared your comments with our practice administrator, and she is more than happy to discuss this with you. Please call (256) 801-6804 at your convenience.

name: Lana Dempsey
text:
The Heart Center was a life saving experience for our dad. He received treatment for over 5 years from St. Thomas hospital in Nashville & we never saw positive results. Numerous times we asked why a certain treatment wasn't used and were given bogus answers. Dad's first visit to the Heart Center & being under the care of Dr. Cash was truly a blessing. Dr. Cash immediately identified dad's need to have a pacemaker. Surgery was scheduled, completed, and sucessful. Sadly, several years after receiving his pacemaker dad was diagnosed with Stage IV metastasized lung cancer. Dad had issues of panic/anxiety attacks which were originally thought to have been heart related. After visits and test with Dr. Cash, he diagnosed him with anxiety attacks, just from the shear stress of being a cancer patient. Dr. Cash went above and beyond to care and treat our dad. He prayed with our family and was genuinely concerned for dad as well as our family. We are very grateful to Dr. Cash and his office.
We HIGHLY recommend The Heart Center.

resp.text: Hello Mrs. Dempsey. We really appreciate your heartfelt review and will be sure to share it with Dr. Cash.

name: cheryl strickland
text: Huntsville Hospital is a FOR PROFIT, PRIVATELY OWNED hospital who has to answer to stock holders. Therefore their profit margin is much more important than patient care and treatment.  Some of their policies reflect that also. For instance, if you go to the ER needing surgery, if there is not a DR. to do that surgery on duty, you will have to wait until one is scheduled if it "probably" won't kill you to wait.  My husband waited 3 days for an orthopedic surgeon for a spiral break in his femur, which is a very dangerous bone to break. It's where our blood supply is made and when broken, releases air bubbles and clots into the blood stream so he was kept on blood thinners for 3 days before major surgery.  Now, not only did the hospital get to charge us for those 3 extra days and all his normal medications, because you are NOT allowed to take your own from home, but they did NOT have to pay a surgeon overtime or vacation pay to come in when off duty, so we are cash cows to that hospital.  The nurses are horribly underpaid and badly treated, but with Huntsville Hosp. owning all hospitals for 8 counties, they really don't have a lot of choices. Most of the nurses were wonderful, however the Dr.'s, especially Dr. Wright, made us feel like our health was secondary to profit, pushing hard for procedures we are very hesitant about and offering no real evidence they would even help. In fact he told us straight out that it probably would not help, but it just might.  Just be aware the Dr.'s are Huntsville Hospitals life blood money and do your research, ask lots of questions, ask about safety and recalls for any hardware they want to implant. In our case the Defibrillator manufacturer was being sued in a class action suit because the leads were corroding and impaling the arteries, but they were still using these defibs and when we asked about them Dr. Wright's answer was, and I quote "they all have problems". Now that's not exactly comforting.  We told him we wanted to do some research and think about it, but that did not stop his office from calling us EVERYDAY for 3 weeks until I asked them not to call us ever again, we would call them if we changed our minds. Then we were told it was their job to "recruit 12 to 18 surgeries PER DAY".  Yes after 35 years of marriage, it is an "us" decision.  We both feel very uncomfortable with it all. We are going for a second opinion at Vanderbilt. I'll update and post what they tell us.

To the last time I told her that I really needed help about getting my appointment schedule. She sends me to a dead end then I can't call back cuz it's after 5. Of course all this is because she just want to go home. Started this process today at 2 p.m. I call back at 4:30 only to get basically get the run around for 30 mins and hung up on. name: Jim Gordon
text: The Heart Center (THC) is responsible for some of the highest-quality medical care I've ever had.  From the scheduling, to the support staff, to the physicians, their care and professionalism have been uniformly excellent.  A few years ago, after experiencing "the bends" on a scuba trip to the Caribbean, I was tested at THC the day after returning to Huntsville.  After an ultrasound test, I was diagnosed with a "patent foramen ovale", or a hole in my heart.  Within a few days, surgery was scheduled, the hole was repaired, and I was home, feeling great.  I've had several other tests at THC, including a very successful cardiac catheterization.  I would heartily recommend THC to anyone who has, or suspects any cardiac issues.

name: Kathy Sanders
text:
My Mother is a patience at the heart center and to date it has been a very unpleasant experience.  I am sure that the doctors there are great at their job.  I think Mother has had ok care.
After several calls and no return calls back, we have managed to get the job done.  My Mother was in the hospital in January and ended up on a ventilator, the day she was released from the hospital the heart center was to come down and review her medication.  Never showed, but we had an appointment with her Doctor in a week so thought all would be good, but that appointment was changed, and then changed again.  Yesterday she went into see the dr and he had no idea what meds she was taking and what milligrams, are you kidding me, your nurse practitioner never showed up to review medications.  She is on coreg which needs to be taken two times a day, but the orders said one.  They changed her meds to hydralazine along with the coreg, the hydralazine is to be taken three times a day, but again the orders said once a day. Yesterday they took her blood pressure in the office and said it was 120/70, and my sister said that is strange. It has been running high, and she snapped back well not today.  Then the dr took it and it was 200/94, really.  On the way home from work last night my sister stopped to pick up meds and only one was there, a water pill, not the increased dosage of coreg or hydralazine.  Either this office is very incompetent or they have way to many patience.  Our Mother is very precious to us, and she has been through hell and back.  She deserves better treatment than this .
