ISO new primary care physician

name: Jessica Jones
text: Its sad when the people at the front desk are very rude and are too worried about partying after work. I had to get a school excuse (so my sister could go back to school that day) for my sister and she wouldn't give us one and made us wait for 15 minutes for a peice of paper. The people in the back were amazing they were kind and generous.

name: Christina Roberson
text: My mother goes to this practice and her Dr is awesome, but the office part is unorganized, rude, and plain unprofessional. It makes you wonder how in the world the people at the front desk even got their degree or if they are educated. It is a nightmare to try to get a refill on a medication. It's impossible. The only way to get them is when you actually see the doctor.. if you forget to get a refill when you see the doctor well your screwed until the next month basically. We live about a hour away from there so we can not just go by there everyday trying to get one refill. Today I called about a refill and have been trying to get this refill now for over a week and eventually instead of helping me they hung up on me. I just am beyond aggravated. My mom really likes her dr and his nurse is so sweet, but it's getting to the point that I'm seriously considering finding her another doctor bc of the fact everything about the front desk is just so unprofessional. When we gofor my mother's appt I'm going to complain about this and try to get a number that is a direct line to my mom's Dr or his nurse. I advise anyone who's thinking about coming to this practice to find another Dr office. It you are a new patient it's not worth the hassle

name: Felicia Wise
text: Great staff, great  doctor, they really listen to you and take all precautions and does test on site!

name: robert foshee
text: Dr. Ridgeway is the best at patient care.. he listens and lets you talk and doesn't cut you off!!

name: David Little
text: Your gonna spend at least 4 hours to see a doctor for 5 minutes  I quit going I got tired of going up there and they couldn't give me a answers for any problem I was having. All they care about is when you coming back to pay them some more money again at Shoals Primary Care

name: Janice Nix
text: They are professional, and have patience. They really work with you to get your health in order.

name: K
text: At 19 years old I became a patient of Brad Ginevan MD. After my current pediatrician, Dr. Rivas, advised it was time to transition to an adult provider. During the time he was my provider, Dr. Ginevan worked alongside my psychiatrist to continue maintenance of my ADHD and when necessary, he worked with specialists to manage my delicate GI condition. This included references to appropriate clinics and scheduling of applicable tests ie. Colonoscopy, EGD, etc. I truly trusted Dr. Ginevan and was incredibly grateful to have found such a wonderful physician. I never minded the fact that his office was always moving locations or that his appointments had become a nightmare to secure. I still referred only my closest of friends and family to see him. Always assuring them they'd be nothing less than satisfied with him as they're provider. Those were the old days... in 2013 I moved away to live on base with my then husband. I moved back in 2015 and returned to Dr. Ginevan. He and his staff had undergone a complete restructuring as they were now a part of the mega-merger trend and had merged with the tri-cities health giant Shoals Primary Care LLC. Due to the merger Dr. Ginevan no longer had any of my previous medical records from all of my time spent under his care which led to massive complications to my continuity of care. (I now understand the importance of my responsibility to secure medical history documentation and maintain my own current updated personal medical record.) Also, SADLY, due to the implementation of a governmental-esque standard of operating procedures, it is my opinion that Dr. Ginevan no longer maintained the level of patient care he had became known for. His office staff has always been grade-A; to be commended. If you are considering seeing Dr. Ginevan as your primary care provider this review is for you. In closing I want to say that this review in no way, intends to slander or cause malice. This review is my personal experiential reference/opinions of Dr. Ginevan meant solely for the purpose of socially informing fellow peers.

name: Shelby Stanford
text: Most of the staff is nice but they are very unorganized. Too many hands touching paperwork

name: Dawn Wheeler
text: Dr. Karr is a wonderful doctor,  he sure cares about his patients,  I would highly recommend Dr. Karr!

name: Renae Miller
text: Myself and my family of 4 have been using Dr Syed for 15 years...I cannot say enough of good things about him. He is very professional, courteous, and extremely intelligent, most of all, he is thorough . DR SYED  will perform tests needed to evaluate your concerns .In my opinion, he IS the best

name: Kimberly Heupel
text: I have seen many Drs from all over and these Drs has done a complete work up on me I am at Dr now and shoals primary Care has all the Drs you could need in this building I'm very pleased with them and they have their own machines here so you don't have to go to the hospital for any kind of scans  I give them 5 stars

name: Diamond Love
text: Dr Karr is a wonderful doctor.  He really cares about his patients well being.

name: Em Means
text: I had planned to start seeing Dr. Martin as a new patient after my husband's first visit (where they had down on his chart that he was a 60 year old female with impacted bowls). I ignored that fact and still decided to give the doctor the benefit of the doubt because I could understand things sometimes happen. However, upon my scheduled visit as a first time patient it was for 7:30 am, and I arrived at 7:15 am for new patient paper work. I signed in and no one even showed up at the front desk until my appointment time, where I  then asked for my paper work and filled it out. About ten minutes after that, another woman called me by the wrong name and when I corrected her, I was made to feel as if I had done something wrong. Also, you can not hear when you are being called because the TV is loud, so people are talking over the TV, and I have two ear infections. After filling out my paper work, I was then called back to the window, where I was asked to write down my SSN, but I had already written it down twice on the form already. This told me they obviously were not paying attention to the information they were entering. After this, and already feeling on edge from just the front desk experience, I am called back by the doctor's nurse practitioner who tells me to step on the scale, and with a horrible tone says, "you're going to have to take some of that off." Meaning my purse. I ask where I should put it in case of a designated area, which seem to make her even more annoyed and she replies with, "I don't know." Very snappy. I am a new patient and felt like I was asking a very simple and non offensive question. We then walk to the exam room where she informs me that I would not be seeing the doctor and that he also would never been doing my exams or ever seeing me other than a quick peek in the room. Which, as someone looking for a long term doctor, it does not feel comfortable not even meeting my doctor on the first visit. When I tried to explain that I was uncomfortable with the fact she would only be relaying my issues to the doctor, and that I didn't feel comfortable having my health looked after in third person, and that I didnt understand why they wouldn't tell a new patient to begin with when making an appointment that he or she won't be seeing a doctor. She then got upset about it and told me I could reschedule or abort because she had been doing this for 40 years. Which is fine and I explained to her I was fine with her seeing me, but that I didn't feel comfortable having a doctor diagnose me without speaking with me and knowing me as a person. She gets more upset and I said I think it would be best just to cancel because at that point, being someone who has been diagnosed with a generalized anxiety disorder, I was overwhelmed and ready to go home. She proceeded to then say to me, "Fine then. Adios." I feel as if the entire situation was unprofessional on many different levels. I decided to keep searching for a new doctor. I would not advise this practice if you want to get to know your doctor for long term use, or have anxiety issues, seeing as how it is the only doctor's office I have ever been in where the lobby is loud and over packed.

name: Shamea C
text: I really like Dr. Ridgeway alot, I've been seeing him for over 5 years. He is an excellent pulmonologist, but his front desk ladies are really very rude..

name: Martin Painter
text: Dr. Karr is the best doctor I’ve ever been with!!!

name: Samantha Smith
text: Well where do I start.... First I guess I could start off with the fact the receptionist are very rude. Next I am being seen by Dr Aaron karr aka his assistant for a blood clot in my liver. So as I'm being processed for my visit the nurse asks me." Ma'am which side is your blood clot on".........eeerrrmmm. unless I have 2 livers it is on my right side. I over looked that. NEXT , I go in for my inr check and my levels are still below standard so he send me to Hellen Keller to do bloodwork and says he will call with the results. No call..... Instead I call up there later in the day and she says you need to come pick up you medicine. So I go get it they have switched my medicine with no telling me no nothing I am a breastfeeding mother. He switched me to a medicine that I cannot breastfeed on without any consultation. I had to Google the risks and side effects. Totally unprofessional and a headache. I will be switching doctors asap!

name: Jennifer Sandy
text: This is where I work.  Busy place, but doctors really care about their patients.

name: Jennifer Faulkner
text: Waiting time long

name: Jason Smallwood
text: Dr Ridgeway is a good doctor

name: Trisha Dean
text: Sat in the waiting room for an hour then was moved to a tiny hallway for another 30 this is my Dr office and it sucks whole experience was terrible

name: Tina Peden
text: Great

name: Janet Jones
text: Prompt, friendly, full-service care

name: Jerry Boykin
text: Awesome

name: Sean O'Donohue
text: Recently had my first visit there with Dr. Yoe. Everyone was professional and friendly and make you comfortable right away. Great first experience I'll be going back soon

name: taj101276
text: I am extremely disappointed with this place. I have nothing but problems here. 1st They tell me they have faxed my request for an ablation procedure. It could take up top 2 months to get approval. After 6 weeks I call my insurance company to find out that they faxed the request to the wrong telephone number. They called me a few days before my procedure and told me they were going to call me in a Rx to take before my subscription. They never called it in and now I'm waiting for them to call it in. I pray to God they do not amputate my leg. I have been severely disappointed with this place. I would suggest you go somewhere else.

name: Cinthia Zavala
text: My mother was given post op instructions to not be sitting or standing for prolonged periods of time. Five days a week she stands in one place for her eight hour shift. They refused to call that a restriction so my mother had no excuse at work for those restrictions/instructions to get up and move more frequently. Then when I asked them for those new instructions in writing they refused as well. I'm assuming it's because they don't want to get sued if there is a post op complication. The receptionist is extremely rude and condescending.

name: James Schilling
text: Very professional staff and Doctors

name: Tonia Black
text: It's hard enough to have problems and have to see the dr. It's even worse when they have a receptionist that thinks she is better than you and basically calls you a liar about your appointment time. I had proof as well. My time is just as valuable. So since I don't play those games I left. You should not have to deal with rude employees!

name: M Little
text:
I normally do not complain however, I do feel as though I was taken advance of and that Birmingham Vein Center,  Address: 100 Pilot Medical Dr Suite 185, Birmingham, AL 35235 did knowingly made false claims to me the patient!
On advice of my regular Doctor he wanted me to have a check up with a heart Doctor since 7 years ago I had open heart surgery and a heart attack.  He recommended Birmingham Heart Clinic- 100 Pilot Medical Center Drive and made an appointment for me. On first impressions I showed up on time and paid by copay and sat down.. I was about 15 minutes early so as with most Doctors I expected a wait.  Well within a few minutes they called me back.  Very impressed that they would actually keep on time with my appointment.. After screening the Doctor wanted to do a stress test and a few more test on my heart and leg veins since I had also had blood clots.. I agreed to these procedures and have no problem with that service.  After the test the Nurse said the Doctor would call in a few days with the results.  Well after two weeks I contacted the Doctors office several time and finally received a call back that everything was good that the Doctor had been on vacation.
In a few months I heard from the Doctor’s office again wanting to schedule an endovenous vein treatment procedure and they had cleared it finally with my insurance company.  This is really when the problem started:  The first treatment was scheduled for August 28 and at the time of scheduling I asked several times throughout the phone call what my out of pocket cost would be.. I was told by the lady and I hate I did not get her name that the procedure was being covered completely by my insurance that I would not have to pay anything.. $0.00!!! Well I went more into that with her she said it was “preventive” so I would not have any cost involved.  WELL that’s where I should have got that statement in writing.. Cause that was totally a LIE!
After having two procedures with really no noticeable results.. But I was optimistic that that would help with my legs..
Everything good until I called in December and was planning on making a payment only to find out the bill was upward $3,200.00.. We I was not prepared for that.. I told Lexi the lady in billing this story.  She said she would call me back the next day which should have been December 16th.. I finally got a call December 18th that she was working on this and would contact me back on Monday with her finding..
Christmas came and went; New Year’s come and went… Finally January 28th I received a call (voice message at work) that she had been trying to reach me.. Yeah right!   In which I called her right back.  She proceeded to tell me that no one there would say such a thing that they did not know what my insurance would pay or not pay.. Keep in mind for two months the Doctor’s office kept submitting to my insurance company request to do the surgery and was the one who received the approval from the insurance company.. I asked who set up the surgery in the first place but of course Lexi said they have not record of that..  YEAH RIGHT!  She proceeded to tell me I would have to pay the $3,216.37. I have asked for copies of my complete file and all bills related to me.
POINT IS!  THINK long and hard and get in writing if you ever us Birmingham Heart and Vein Center cause what they say is not what they do!
I am totally convinced this is how they make their extra money by saying one thing and doing another.  Lexi even had the nerve to tell me I would be charged late fees for not paying.. Think I will send Lexi a late bill myself since it only took her 42 days to get back in touch with me about this bill.
I am hear by disputing these charges of $2,741.10 and any past due expense added to my bill!

name: DJ McCurdy
text: I see and trust Dr. Brock.  Everyone I interact with is professional and courteous. People need to realize that not all are associated with CVA. There are a number of people that work for the hospital.  However I have found them to be as pleasant and helpful as anyone as well. Overall I look forward to going.  My wife is also a patient there so we get twice the opportunity for issues. We both rate the  whole building a 5.

name: anna cash
text: Rushed appointment. I wasn't able to get an echo or blood work because everyone was gone! The nurse wrote my information on a scrap sheet of paper & didn't chart any of it because the nurse that called me a month later was completely lost. My follow up was a phone call to read the results of my heart monitor and I was charged $200! Good luck contacting a nurse or Dr if needed!

name: Amy L
text: Visit from start to finish took 2.5 hours but about 2 of those hours were spent in the waiting room. From the moment I entered, the lady at the front did not look like she wanted to be there. The dr also did not seem happy either. The explanations were not clear on directions of where to go next and why tests were needed. The most concerning part of the visit was when the phlebotomist touched his ungloved hand on my disinfected arm before drawing blood. The visit overall gave me a lot of anxiety, and I did not feel cared for.

name: Beverly Lang
text: Great place with lots of on-site testing. Also, some of the best and nicest doctors and nurses around.

name: Jacqueline Moore
text: My husband had a stent procedure March 24th. After coming home the next day, he was having some discomfort. He called the CVA office ( off of 280: Colonnade Parkway) 3/26 around 10:20 a.m. He asked the receptionist to have Dr. Sample’s nurse to call him. His wrist ( which was the first place they tried to place his stent) was in pain and a knot had come up on his wrist. The nurse never called that day. He called again Tuesday, 3/30. After several tries, he finally talked to the nurse. Today, 4/2, he called and asked the receptionist to have the nurse to call him because his legs were cramping. He is concerned that he is having a reaction to the medicine that Dr. Sample prescribed. No nurse called him back today. The receptionist told him that it may take 48 hours for someone (nurse or doctor) to call him back. What does the patient do in this situation? It seems that CVA is not able to take of the patients after perform a procedure on them. We need advice and help from management from this facility. Overall, the main problem is getting a nurse to call my husband to help him.

name: Alan Creighton
text: Dr. Eagan has taken great care of my mother and father over the last ten years.  His knowledge and professionalism has been excellent.  He listens, is considerate, answers our questions and guides us as we make decisions regarding our health care.  I highly recommend him.

name: Susan Bowen
text: Usually visits are well organized with great heart doctors. Today they were OFF!  Wear mask in the building, ok that’s fine!  By the time we left, no one at desk to check us out, they had gone home. Thank goodness for the sweet custodial lady who found someone to help us.  Go to ask a clinical tech, a question pull my mask down, hatefully she says, PUT THAT MASK ON NOW!!!  OK, I also tell her as I walk off I don’t have the Corona.  She’s worried about me standing 6 feet away , asking 1 question. When you stop for temp check, they put O2 meter on your finger, but not ONCE DID THEY CLEAN IT,between the patients that came in after me.   Glad I went to bathroom and washed my hands after we were checked in.  But has excellent doctors!

name: Shelley Roman
text: I had the worst service here with my mother. She was seeing Dr. Hasabnis and he basically scolded us saying she doesn’t need a heart specialist. She just needs a primary care doctor even though we got a referral. He was completely rude and had no bedside manners. I work with many doctors and have never been in such an uncomfortable situation. He is what is wrong with medical care and why many people are afraid to see the doctor. I am very disappointed in his attitude and unprofessional demeanor.

name: Randy Thompson
text: Can't get results back in a timely manner. Nobody will answer phone when you call in. I was on hold 28 minutes. I plan to change Cardiologists in the near future. This place went down hill fast after Dr. Larry Dye and Kathy Black left...

name: Patrick Hubbard
text: Dr. Eagan at CVA is one of the most professional physicians I have ever met.  He cares deeply about his patients and is always available in times of concern.  Their office staff is professional and kind and their check-in system is efficient and quick.

name: Ben Doerner
text: Always strive to take great care of you.

name: Olin Barnes
text: Dr. Eagan and staff are excellent / attention to detail and follow up has been great CVA is very professional

name: Michael Baygents
text: This was my first appointment with CVA and my experience was outstanding. I anticipated having to wait for hours, but this was not the case. After a short wait, I was back with Dr. Percy Colon. I highly recommend him. He sits down with you and talks instead of some other places that make you feel like cattle being herded through. I needed to have a stress test done and he got me in to go ahead and be tested instead of having to come back. This helped because I live out of town. After taking the test, I was told I would probably hear from them the following week. Dr. Colon called me himself after hours to let me know my results were good. I highly recommend them.

name: Elizabeth Hughes
text:
I had such a pleasant experience at CVA. The staff was very courteous and kind. From the moment I walked in, the process was very smooth and flowed well.  I was impressed on how well the office was laid out to follow the guidelines of social distancing and to protect the health of patients with COVID screening.
I was seen by Dr. Eagan and was very impressed. He listened to everything that I had to say and was very knowledgeable. His bed-side manner was very calming. Nowadays doctor’s offices make you feel like a number but not here.  I will definitely recommend Cardiovascular Associates to family, friends and co-workers.

name: Paula Weaver
text: I Love the CVA!  DR. M Honan saved my life in June 2012. I will give him praises tillI die!  The CVA clinic has a WONDERFULStaff.  MS.Kimberely, Wade, and every one else in the PT/INR clinic are very friendly and helpful.  I think the world of these ppl.  I wouldn't go any other place!  THank you Dr. Honan and all his staff!!

name: tim sheppard
text: Dr. White is excellent, but it's easier to get help from Comcast or the Government than contacting his office staff.  Somebody in management needs to lose their job over this level of complete incompetence.  I have now logged 117 minutes on hold for 3 calls to reschedule an appointment.  Simply not worth the hassle.

name: Dianne Vetrano
text:
Love my Doctor but 3-4 hour wait to see him is not acceptable. I am always on time and expect the same
Courtesy. I don’t blame the Doctor, I don’t know what the problem is, but it needs to get resolved or I am changing  Docs.

name: Mike Fortenberry
text: I will miss Dr Jerry Chandler one of the greatest doctors I have ever known. Happy Retirement go enjoy life.

name: Miranda Maxam
text: I have been seeing Dr. Brock for a few years now and he has always made me feel as though I was his only patient. He always takes his time during the appointment and explores all options and avenues when it comes to patient care. I would recommend Dr. Brock to anyone that will listen. He is kind and compassionate and I never feel like just a number. All of the nurses I have dealt with have been pleasant and the front desk is just fine as well. They handle a lot of patients so during the times that I have had to wait, it is completely understandable, although, I have never had to wait more than 15 minutes for my appointment. Truly great care with Dr. Brock.

name: Pat Sparks
text: Too bad the call staff doesn't match the wonderful physicians. It took a total of 12 minutes to make a follow up appointment and nearly 9 minutes of that was spent listening to the recording telling me how important we are to them. If you have an emergency, do not put your trust into waiting on someone who cares to answer your call. There seems to be something going on within this practice and it isn't the physicians.

name: Ronnie Rivera
text: Dr. White and all the staff are great. They are caring and provide the best care available.

name: Mick Gurley
text: Wait time is unbearable.  Sometimes 2.5-3 hours.  On one visit, I drove 45 miles for an apt. and just as I was pulling into the parking lot they called me and asked if I’d mind rescheduling.  I told her it was okay and could she call me the next day.  She promised she would.  I never heard back.  I’ve had at least 4 issues with this practice not calling/faxing a prescription in.  Starting tomorrow, I will have to start cutting a particular pill in half because my prescription was not called in... AFTER TWO PROMPTS.  I spoke with the office manager two days ago and was told it would be taken care of.  It wasn’t.  Caremark cancelled my order.  I have called twice today to speak with the office manager and the second time, I was told she’d call me back in 30 minutes.  It’s now been two hours.  I think I know now where the problem lies.  As much as I like Dr. Reeves,  I’ll be looking for a different, smaller practice.

name: Judy Rowe
text:
My husband, Joe Rowe, is a Patient of Dr. Harrison.  He had triple bypass surgery with aortic valve replacement two years ago.  On Wednesday night, 4/3/19, he experienced some of the classic symptoms of a heart attack. He became extremely dizzy, broke out in a sweat and was nauseated but did not have chest or arm pain. Our neighbor who is a doctor came over and assisted with this episode. He administered aspirin, one nitroglycerin, and checked Joe’s vital signs. Vital signs were good and we were advised to call CVA on Thursday morning, 4/4/2019, to tell a nurse or doctor about this event and see if we needed to see the doctor. I called and spoke with a nurse around 9:45 am on Thursday, 4/4, giving her all details and also telling her that we were waiting on the results of a chest X-ray and cardiac PET scan which Joe had done the week before. She was going to try and obtain the results of these tests.  I also requested that she inform Dr. Harrison of Joe’s experience. She promised to call me back on Thursday afternoon whether she got the test results or not. As of 4pm today, we have not heard from the nurse or a doctor. We are extremely disappointed and upset that we have received no response. This is just wrong on all levels. Thank God that Joe has not experienced any of those symptoms again.

We are now debating whether to look for another doctor. We have always trusted Dr. Harrison and felt very comfortable under his care. Perhaps he was not even told about this event. We don’t know. We only know that the nurse we spoke with or a doctor should have called us back.

name: John Gasser
text: I called to make an appointment after being on hold for 30 minutes I gave up. If they won't answer their phone it makes one wonder if they really care and respect their patients. Find a cardiologist who is responsive. I know NOTHING about the level of care provided all I know for sure is that the group does not respect the time of potential patients.

name: Jennifer Varnell
text: Each time I visit I am impressed by the organization of the office flow!  I love my CVA doctor!

name: Russell Glasgow
text: As long as you can be seen in an outlying office your experience is tolerable   If you have anything done at the Colonade office you need to bring War and Peace, Gone With The Wind or just be prepared to memorize the entire Old Testament.   There is NO regard given to an appointment time for rudimentary procedures. My appointment was at 1:15 for an echo cardio gram. I was taken to s room after waiting  an hour and forty five minutes.   This is ludicrous.  The extent was I apologize we are running a little behind. Today’s visit would cause me to change doctors completely if I were not highly satisfied with my cardiologist and his staff.  Animals are treated better at the emergency veterinary office. I am completely disgusted with my service today.  Once I finally was taken to a room my procedure was fine and the person administering the Echo was great. It is obvious as a professional that quality is not part of this clinics formula.

name: Lynn O
text: Went for an ECHO, it took over an hour just to register. When you arrive they give you one of the restaurant pagers, it never went off.  You'd think as much money as Cardiologist make they could make their office support staff more efficient.

name: Barry Sadler
text: Dr. White was great but staff, front office and call service are terrible. I was told they requested insurance clearance to do some test prior to seeing my surgeon for an an operation. Testing lab never called so I called back and was told the insurance had not cleared so I called the insurance company 3 days later and was told the doctor's office never requested clearance. Every time you call the answering service it takes a minimum of 20 minutes of waiting and so far nothing good has come of it. Still waiting.

name: Julia Anderson
text:
Great experience.  Dr.Hasabnis is a very great doctor with a good bedside manner as long as there are no problems, then out goes the bedside manner.
His nurse is very efficient.
If there is a problem Dr. H is on it.
The Heart Lab is very good and efficient.
Wait time for either place is not a  problem.
I wouldn’t go anywhere else.

name: John W Gregory
text: i have had 3 appointments this year for follow up for A Fib and BP. The experiences have all been positive (especially since I had a good review). Also, the staff was courteous and the time for the appointment was met in a timely fashion. Dr. Mirza was helpful with my questions and did not seem rushed. I am happy with CVA.

name: Amy Holliman
text: Horrible experience!  The administration of this practice is terrible.  You WILL hold for at least 20-30 minutes every time you call and what they tell you can't be relied upon.  I even wrote a letter to the Practice Administrator and my physician and was completely ignored.  Chances are the letter was never opened and/or given to them!  Although my doctor was good, the challenges in scheduling appointments or speaking with anyone overrides that.  Find a practice that actually cares about the value of your time!

name: Jon McClaran
text: I am forever grateful by the professional and compassionate care I have received at CVA. All the staff, Ms. Sanford, Dr. Macy Smith, and Dr. Steve Bakir, have made a huge impact on my health and quality of my life. Thank you's don't seem to be enough....but Thank You!!

name: Nancy White
text: Dr Bakir is the best but the administrative staff is a nightmare. Rude!!! You can never get anyone to call you back! I'm thinking of changing offices just because the staff is horrible.  I've been without meds for five days and they won't call my pharmacist back

name: Jerry Ross
text: Had an appointment with Dr Reeves on May 6.    I was told by nurse, prior to seeing Dr Reeves, they had a new computer system that was consuming everyone's time.     Finally, after over 2 hours of waiting, he came in.   There was a lot of confusion concerning my history during our visit.    I've only been seeing him 11+ years now.   When I got home and read the Visit Summary I had been given when leaving the appointment I see that I am in heart failure mode and we discussed all of the symptoms, restrictions, etc.  None of that is true, including heart failure, unless they've been holding back all of these years.    Tried to call and talk to someone 2 times in the last week about this and they still have not returned my calls.    They have a new patient portal and I tried numerous times to call and get help logging in so I could send a note.   Busy signal every time I called.    So, my choices are, 1) schedule another appointment with a 3 hour wait or 2) move on to another doctor.    Seriously considering the latter since it seems they have more patients than they can manage.

name: Berney Waite
text: I was a patient of Dr. Morris for years and then Dr. Dye until he recently retired. I could not have entrusted my health to two better physicians. They were both very caring and reassuring and I always left with a lot of confidence. I never had to wait to the point that it bothered me. A great place.

name: Jane Gray
text:
Used my cardio Dr before he jioned CVA. I was trying to make appt and called a dozen times over 2 weeks, morning and afternoon. No answer after holding for 10 -20 minutes. Called and went to Billing and by george they answered first try!
When said I had been trying for 2 weeks to get appt - she said " We have over 20 doctors we answer for" .  Well I guess you don't need me then with that attitude!
I will transfer to a Cardio doctor that can answer calls from his patients whenever they call!
Dr Jacobs, if you see this and think you can salvage your patient, you do have until end of November, that is if you care about your patients like you seemed to before, to contact me.
Jane Gray.

name: Debbie Betters
text:
Dr Eagan is amazing! My mom is 95 and he was very patient and kind. The reception area is
great and staff was wonderful, except for a nurse (Julie). She was unprofessional, condescending, and argumentative.

name: Brenda “B3” Third
text: Smooth set up. My husband and I have seen several different Drs and CRNPs. He has been seening Dr Chandler since late 90's. Our extended family uses this group as well. Lots of experience using the group and we love  them. Not sure why others have had a negative experience. We highly recommend.

name: Alexandrea Nations
text: Just wasted half of my day sitting at CVA. I was scheduled for a 9 a.m. appointment for my yearly check up with my cardiologist. After waiting almost an hour I had my EKG done and my blood pressure checked and was then asked to sit in the waiting room because my doctor didn't have a room available. I continued to wait until it was almost 12:30 and politely walked to the front desk and asked them to cancel my appointment because I had already waited 3 and a half hours and I had to go to work. This is the 2nd time I have had a significant wait time, the last being over 4 hours. The ladies at the front desk were extremely apologetic and asked who I was there to see. When I told them (Dr. Reeves), they suggested I find another doctor. I don't know if this is a doctor issue or a facility issue but I will not be back.

name: Karen Kaetz
text: Dr Colon is great.  I am changing cardiologists  after many years due to the extreme challenges of working with the "front office"; extended hold times, dropped calls, lack of customer focus, no follow through.   The worst customer experience.

name: Night Raider
text:
I'm very picky about who sees my mom especially since I've taken her to so many and same bad results with the long waits, cold and unfriendly atmosphere and the Dr. that acts like he or she don't want you to be there. This is the best facility with the best Dr. I've been to by far!
Easy to find, easy parking and will help you out if you need help getting mom or dad out of your car.There is a very friendly young lady just inside the door that will come help you out, all you have to do is step inside and ask. We have never been there over an hour and a half and that says a lot compared to all the others (and there's been lots of others)  Very friendly associates and they don't treat you like a number like most places we've been. I give this place and the Dr. two thumbs up👍👍 and so does my mom.

name: scot sharp
text:
This is the message I sent after seeing dr Brock for my elderly mother. They did not even respond.

i just want your office to know how horrible my mother was treated when attempting to seek medical care from your office. on the recommendation of my aunt, who has been in the medical industry for over 40 yrs, we came in to see dr brock. he was not the kind and compassionate man your website describes. instead he was short rude and seemed as if he did not care at about my mother or her health. without test results back yet, he insisted that we come back the next day as if it were an emergency. when we got there, his nurse did not seem to know why we were there at all. when he entered the room, he was smacking on gum loudly like an adolescent child. he proceeded to tell us that he did not have all of the testing back yet but his recommendation was a pace maker, which shocked my mother. when she asked him to give her some more substantial reasons for why she needed the pace maker, his only repeating answer was bc that was his recommendation and if we did not like it, then he would be happy to get another doctor to see us. it came across as not only uncompassionate and unkind, but condescending. it appeared to us both that he was saying he wanted to put in a pacemaker and if we didn't want that then we knew where the door was. he was rude, unprofessional, uncompassionate, and quite frankly exhibited the characteristics of someone on drugs...the complete opposite of the man described on your website. treating patients in that manner is completely unacceptable! based on his reaction to our questions and refusal to give an answer and having not received her test results that would substantiate the need for such a device to be implanted i am of the opinion he gets a kick back of some sort for putting in so many pacemakers, which he bragged about to us during her appointment. i have never sat in a room with a doctor who refused to answer questions and was so dismissive to a patient because they had questions and concerns. i am disgusted with the lack of care for the patients well being that is more than obvious from your office staff and your doctors. i just feel like someone should be aware of the unprofessional manner in which dr brock conducted himself. i hope your organization addresses the things that happened to my mother there. i will be sending letters to the appropriate persons at the medical board as it is my opinion dr brock is not fit to treat patients either because he doesn't care about them or that he is on some kind of drug. completely unacceptable to treat an elderly woman in such a manner!

name: Donna Vickery
text:
I called Cardiovascular Associates today to reschedule an appointment for my husband.  The call was handled promptly, and the CVA employee with whom I spoke was extraordinarily sweet and personable.  The call was so pleasant that I decided to share my experience.  I was shocked to discover some of the negative comments on the CVA website.

My family has trusted this group for years for healthcare needs, beginning with our parents and now my husband and me.  We have always been treated with the utmost courtesy and care.  In fact, a visit to CVA for us is like visiting a trusted family member.  This is a large practice which has garnered the respect of the community and a large following over the years.  On occasion, we may have had a short wait to speak to someone on the phone or to see the doctor; however, we would never even consider changing doctors because this is the most credentialed and caring group of professionals in the field.

name: Stacie Lee
text:
I love Dr. Cavender. He is a very thorough physician and he makes sure to spend time with me each visit to listen to my concerns and allow me to ask questions.

The problems that I have with this is office is around their wait times - both in office and on the phone.  Yesterday I called and waited 30 minutes on the phone and never spoke to an actual person - finally hung up.  I called back at 2:30 pm and was able to get to a voicemail (still never talked to a person) but as of 9:00 am the following day I haven't heard back from anyone. In May, I called and waited 45 minutes on hold. Every time I have an appointment I have to plan to be in the office for at least 2.5 hours.  I spend, at a minimum, 1 hour in the waiting room every visit.

I understand that doctor's offices are in business to make money as well, but when you apparently have so many patients that you can't answer the phone in under 30 minutes or return patient's calls there is a significant problem that needs to be addressed.

name: Alex Muro
text: The quality of patient care is extremely good. I rate my overall experience as one of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had.  Phone calls that ring and are never answered. Appointments that get moved without my consent, requiring another phone call that is never answered.  I even hand delivered a letter to them explaining to them my frustration with their phones--and I got a phone call back even though I told them I was unable to receive calls during normal work hours!!!  Not good for my blood pressure.

name: Nila McBrier
text: The most pathetic response ever!! Called because I have pneumonia and wanted to make sure none of the drugs interacted.  Said would tag it urgent, guess it's not!!  I will sue if they do, and am so disappointed!  Dr. Harrison, really?!?

name: Kaitlyn DeBandi
text: While I love my doctor, the staff is horrible. As a returning patient with a pacemaker, I called to schedule an appointment for a problem with my heart. After sitting on hold for 30 minutes I was told the earliest available was in 3 weeks, regardless of the issue. Then I was transferred to the nurse line. Waited on hold for an additional 30 minutes, no one ever picked up. The cycle repeated the following day with the nurse taking my number and saying she would call me back. No return phone call. When following up AGAIN the following day (3 days after the initial concern) I was told, "Yes, i see that the message has been left for the nurse, they'll call you when they're able." I have seen more concern over patient/customer care when making a dentist appointment or nail appointment. If i performed the way CVA's staff does at my job, I would not have a job. The utter lack of concern over a 29 year old with a history of heart problems and a pacemaker is appalling. I suppose I'm supposed to be an alarmist and go to the emergency room because speaking my  doctor's nurse is clearly an impossibility. Whether the issue is that there are too many patients or not enough staff, CVA needs to resolve immediately because this is ridiculous. If anyone has any alternative cardiologist recommendations, please advise.

name: Yvonne Robinson
text: This was a great facility. Easy to get to and extremely clean. Every one greeted you with a smile and how can I help you. All the nurses were extremely nice and introduced themselves when they walked into the room. They all took time to listen to my mother and her issues. The doctor walked into the room with a smile,hand shake and introduced himself  to my mom, sister and me. For me this goes a long way. I appreciate the time they took for my mom. The waiting time was minimum also. I want to thank everyone for being polite and appreciate everything we learned today.. I will definitely recommend this facility to friends and family.❤️❤️❤️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️👍👍👍👍👍

name: Billie Hamilton
text: I received a call this morning from a nurse calling on behalf of Dr. David Cox. The nurse began to tell me to stop taking a cholesterol medication that was prescribed to me. The medication was actually prescribed to another patient with my name. I was at a lost for words. I asked the nurse did they not think to examine our charts carefully. The nurse spoke in a nonchalant tone and with absolutely no remorse for their mistakes. The nurse also stated that when I came in their office of January 2019 is when the mistake was made. I informed the nurse that I came in the office in June or July of 2018. Again, I am at complete lost of words. It has been 8 months since I was in the office. I began to explain to the nurse that a patient CANNOT just stop taking cholesterol medication once this medication has been in your system for a long period of time. Sudden stops of usage of medication such as cholesterol medicine can result in death. These people are playing with people's lives as if it is a game. Please pay attention to the medication you are being prescribed by doctor's and do your research before taking the medication. I thank the Lord Jesus Christ for keeping from seen and unseen danger.

name: Thad Heinrich
text: I'm  very  well   pleased with  my visit at age 31 I've  needed  serious  answers to serious problems. I've  found them  here. After 6years  of searching, my questions  we're given  answers  that  are leading  to treatment  and recovery. I pray  for the same  wisdom  to help  all.

name: JT Lane
text:
This place is a complete joke.  They do have some supposedly good doctors associated with the facility.  But trust me you are absolutely nothing but a number at this place.  On a blood test, for example, rather than the doctor or nurse call you with the results which would take them less than 3 minutes, they prefer to mail you the results.  When you complain about their lack of attention or follow-up, (when the letter doesn't come), you're told they don't have enough time to make a friendly call to you.

Bottom line, you're a number.  Who knows if the doctor actually looks at test results.  An appointment at the glamorous facility is fine.  But if you have to communicate outside the appointment, it's as if you're dealing with someone 2000 miles away.

name: Chuck Robinson
text: I am a retired dentist and my wife is a Nurse Practitioner. We both recognize excellence, when we are being treated. I would only allow Cardiovascular Associates to treat both my father and myself. There is a difference in CV care available to the Birmingham area patients. Should the need arise, any other family member will be directed to this fine and reasonable group of doctors. I especially want to give a Gold Standard recognition to Dr. Stephen Bakir and Dr. Himanshu Gupta. Theses great doctors would not be there if there were there not equally qualified other doctors at their clinics.

name: Tom Mclemore
text:
Having read other reviews, I had to share that of all the other cardiologist associates in Birmingham. This group is the most caring and professional.
I had an ablation to correct PVCs that were making my life miserable and almost unbearable.
Never had a bad experience with a doctor, nurse, technician or staff. Having been to UAB and St. Vincent s CVA is the best.
Dr Macy Smith is not on great in his field but caring and professional.

name: Jim Kidd
text: Everyone up to and through the care I received was exceptionally attentive to detail and comfort.  Thank you!

name: Spencer
text: The doctors and nurses and techs are nice and knowledgeable. However, every other person on the staff is miserable. Receptionists, appointment makers, billing people are all absolutely abhorrent. Having to deal with them is worse than dealing with the DMV. It’s a shame because it would be 5 star if they replaced their horrible staff. I have yet to interact with a single person that didn’t hate being there and hate having to deal with you as a patient. It’s terrible.

name: Marianne Nichols
text: I do prefer the office at Brookwood Professional Building. Over at the colonnade they give you beepers so you know when it's your turn 😕 The employees have always been pleasant and efficient. I had another cardiologist whom I had been using for 10 years when she retired in 2014. She recommended the Dr. I see now with cva. I like him.

name: John Camp
text:
Had my second stent placement a few weeks ago. Called the office Monday 2-11-19 with complications with meds and minor bleeding issues in the nose. Finally called me back 2-13-19 to follow up. My response, cancel my next appointment as I have already seen another Doctor and problems have been resolved. This place is a joke. #allheartsmatter.

They get one star for being open, that’s all.

name: Cheryl Johnson
text: Wonderful Dr n person. Great bedside manner. I'd recommend him to anyone.

name: Carol Campbell
text: We too have had to wait for physicians in the past, but, Dr. Raburn and his colleagues are worth the wait.  After working for a cardiothoracic surgeon in the past, I guess my expectations regarding the patience of waiting to be seen by a valuable physician may vary somewhat from others, due to the fact, we are usually not aware of the urgent physical needs that YOUR PHYSICIAN may be attending to with another patient.  So, in all fairness, I feel that if we considered the needs of other patients, that may, at that time, require urgent assistance, we ourselves, would want and expect the same treatment.  If it's any consolation, we have had to wait 2 hours at some facilities to be seen by a physician.  Sometimes, you may have to wait for the best!  Warmest regards!

name: Mark K
text: I've been on hold for almost 30 minutes just trying to get one of my prescriptions refilled.  The recording said have the pharmacy call to request a refill but my pharmacy said my dr. doesn't allow fax requests.  Again, I haven't spoken to one person, I'm afraid when someone does come on the line and I tell them I just need a refill they are going to place me on hold again so I can speak to nurse.  Nobody should be on hold for more than 15 minutes.  Not good.

name: Darlina Bray
text: Make sure that you check with your insurance company  before you agree to allow any testing from this physician office.  We had tests ran at this office and the Dr. (who was in our insurance network) sent the tests for reading to an Illinois company that was not in our insurance network and now we are stuck with the bill.

name: Larry Roberts (Pastor)
text: Doctors are excellent (especially Dr. Cavender), however, this place has experienced growing pains.  The organization and working procedures have not kept up with the increase in patients.  The place is a mess to get around in. The people know who you are: patient #12345. No caring  or concern for you in the front lobby area at all.  Still it could be worse: The lack of care in the front could leak to the back!

name: Ramarao Chodavarapu
text: Great doctors. Great technicians. Great experience.

name: Rodney Gilbert
text:
Dr Macy Smith is marvelous..!!! Corrected my atrial fibrillation with a cardiac ablation and my wife’s irregular heartbeat with a pacemaker...excellent bedside manner and patient follow up. Wonderful physician...Highly recommended!!!
CVA check in procedures need modernization ...and computer programs require  updating allowing info sharing with Brookwood Hospitql for testing..imagining .Too much repeating of same data  from visit to visit ??

name: Jan Hall
text: Medicine like a fast food restaurant. Walk in and receive a pager that blinks and buzzes to go pay. Wait to go to another waiting area. Many doctors, one phone line, must get transferred a couple of times just to leave a message. Appointments cancelled by email and rescheduled for 3 weeks later in the middle of a potentially lethal condition requiring surgical intervention. I never felt like a person there. I wasn't put on the standard treatment for my condition. The only decent advice I was given was to travel for surgery. I'm seeing a UAB doctor now.

name: Kari Osborne
text: Great doctors that work together to give patients the best care possible.

name: D1RoyalBama
text: Dr. Harrison is a great cardiologist and recommend him to anyone, with heart issues.

name: Tammy Byess
text: I have seen Dr Eagan & Dr Rayburn for cardiomyopathy for over 15yrs. Great facility with easy parking & everything under one roof.

name: David Atkins
text:
Dr. Rao was very professional and seemed quite knowledgeable.  However, when I phoned back a couple of days later with some questions
and was told that they would be given to the Dr. and someone would call me back, I never heard from anyone. Disappointed about this.

name: Mary Jane Casey
text: Love the associate with the wonderful doctor and the,nurses are very pleasant with courtesy

name: JAMES B
text: Inexcusable delays in trying to get responses from doctor's nurse - either through phone or their patient portal. Have waited days to get answers to critical questions. Maybe too many patients?

name: May Ali
text: Waited for 2 hours they were about to close and the doctor did not show up !! Left without seeing him never called or apologized very very rude no respect for patient time what so ever

name: Shelia Akin
text: Dr.Cox has a very bad bed side manner.

name: Anthony Thorn
text: Incompetence on all levels of post appointment management trust McDonald's more than I do these folks with my wife's care.

name: Aerial Johnson
text: Wait time to see the doctor is ridiculous.

name: Jack Trawick
text: The check in process sucked. Appt was at 0730 arrived at 0715. Didn't start check in until 0800. Meanwhile there four clerks sat around chatting about the weekend.

name: Linda Hames
text: Dr. Katta has been my doctor for 23 years. He is a very compassionate, highly educated and experienced Cardiologist. He has saved my life a lot, in my opinion he is the best Cardiologist, I wouldn't see anyone else. He has a large waiting room and sign-in desk. His staff are friendly and helpful. He has the capability to run most all test at his office. The office temperature is lower than regular doctor offices, due to the health of his heart patience needs. Also if you let the staff know you are cold they'll get you a warm blanket. I would and do recommend Dr. Katta to anyone who needs his services.

name: Hugh Callahan
text: I wouldn't take my pet to this practice. Some members of his staff are extremely rude. Additionally, he doesn't review records and contact patient with treatment plans. I have had a resting heart rate over 100 beats per minute for 5 weeks, and he hasn't resolved the issue. He relies on his staff too much in that he allows them to review records and change medications, all apparently without his review. He was to have called me last night, he never did. In my opinion, as the son of a physician, he lacks professionalism. I would seek another caregiver if I were you.

name: Teresa Christian
text: Zero bedside manner. I was practically in tears. Dismissed my symptoms even though I was admitted overnight in the hospital. He wants my neurologist to prescribe medication he wants me to take (Doesn't want to take responsibility, perhaps??). I doubt he is used to taking younger patients. It's probably an easy in and out $$f factoryfor him for older people with simpler issues.

name: Marvin Denenny
text: Dr Katta has been my cardiologist for 14 years and he and his staff are the best in North Alabama. I believe I wouldn’t be alive today without him.

name: Andris Bune
text: Dr. Sadasiva is real expert in the field. Have excellent experience with his treatment.

name: Kacie Marsh
text: My experience today did not even deserve a one star rating. Dr. Katta was 3 hours late which could have been okay if he didn't fully dismiss all of my issues because he was in a rush. It was known at the ER two days ago that I was positive for pots,had an irregular heart beat and a small murmur. At 18 years old from sitting to standing alone my heart rate has gone from the 80's to 150's. You would think at MINIMUM he would want to see that and confirm or dismiss the theory of POTS.  Instead he said I had anxiety because I'm young when i have never experienced anything like this before. While at the ER i used a bed pan because they wouldn't even wheel me.. yet I felt Dr. Katta tried to make me feel like this was all in my head when tests at the ER say otherwise.  he won't tell me anything is wrong, and was about to send me home without one question concerning my symptom check list or test. His ASSISTANT suggested a heart monitor and even he gave a bit of an " I'm sorry" look. Dr. Katta's attitude was like fine. Since it was mentioned. Aweful. Would have sent me home without asking about my symptoms or doing one test. I don't even trust him to read my results or care just because I'm younger when cleary something is wrong. I had multiple "yes'" checked on the symptom chart from Siezure to chest pain, numbess to all sorts of more severe things and he didn't have one question for me. I will be cancelling my heart monitor with him and seeing someome that will make me feel cared for. Or who will at least not talk over me, rush and try to send me home. It is not my fault he was late. But the lack of care knowing my symptoms is very far beyond me and my mother. We have never had someone care so little with no interest to listen.

name: Lakshmi Inguva
text: Good

name: Chad kiper
text: Hands down the most friendly office I've visited. Dr. Lyons was great. His staff were super awesome? A+

name: Helen Nixon
text: To be told you need to see a vascular surgeon is a scary thing, even for someone in the medical profession.  Dr Rose (as well as the other doctors I have interacted with as a RN) and her staff CTVSA were very kind and reassuring to my wife and myself. They made sure we understood what was happening and what the next step was to be. Dr Rose and Molly made things much easier for me.

name: Anil Vashi
text: Beware about those hidden costs. Before my procedure i  did ask Dr Melanie Rose to get this procedure approved by my carrier without any surprise since i am on Medicare  and fixed income thus i got billed for another $195 needless to say ultrasound costs charged twice since the results were conflicting due to the outdated and unreliable equipment and also the pain associated with this. To supplement this the dressing broke loose before i got home due to the nurse incompetency. All my complaints left ignored by the staff in the meantime Mobile Infirmary is also to blame for this unacceptable behavior

name: Addie Brockly
text: DR McGee saved my life no doubts about it. I thank God I was sent to him very perfectional and kind caring Doctor.

name: Ashley Fleming
text: Dr. Daniel's performed absolutely fantastic on my  right pneumonectomy. The fact that I am still here 7 years later attest to the fact that he went far above his already high standards to preserve my life. I would very highly reccomend  him to anyone!!!

name: Chuck Purcell
text: Just make sure if he mentions lung cancer, Get A Second Opinion. It seems that not to many can tell the difference from lung cancer and pneumonia until you are missing a piece of your lung or all of it. I went from a supposed health issue to a real health issue since I now have been diagnosed with COPD since part of my lung was removed.

name: Melinda Boggs
text: I couldn't have asked for better care than what Dr. Johnson gave me. I'm alive today because of that man.

name: teresa boggs
text: This group has the absolute worst patient care I have ever experienced. They are slow and unresponsive. Surgery was adequate but patient care was nonexistent.

name: Susie Hartman
text:
The ladies at the desk were so friendly and helpful. The ladies who did the Nuclear Testing were tremendous. What do I say, Dr. Chris Brown is fantastic.
He eased my mind about everything about my heart.  I owe each one a debt of gratitude the way I was taken care of the entire time. Thank you for being so gracious with me. Glad I went to Mobile Heart Specialists. God Bless

name: Barbara Smith-Matthews
text: The entire team was absolutely great; professionals and very efficient. My nurse was exceptional and Dr Bedwell was very thorough and answered the questions I presented.

name: shirley pierce
text: From the inception of my arrival at mobile heart specialist facility I was received and graciously transported into my doctor's office. I am not ambulatory and because of the staff they're at the doctors office I was able to receive the finest of cardiology care.  Every individual who responded to my need for healthcare healthcare was the epitome of professionalism and grace. Combined with expedience and a comfortable atmosphere I could never ask for finer care anywhere.

resp.text: Thank you for your nice words.

name: John Dyess
text: I like how quick they got me back. Love how dr Deanandrade takes his time and answers all my questions. I never feel rushed and I feel like he really listens great job from front desk until I leave!

resp.text: Thank you for the positive feedback and review! We strive to provide exceptional care.

name: Charles Simpson
text:
It was very good. I have been with this group for many years . I like Dr Brown. I was with Dr Meginson who was my father in law’s doctor.
His name was Dr Albert Dix. The staff was helpful and courteous.
Charles Simpson

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and positive review!

name: Paresh Patel
text:
I been going to dr brown for the last 22 years no words to describe staff and dr brown
Will recommend to anyone

resp.text: Thank you for these nice words.

name: Keith McCall
text:
I like Mobile Heart Specialist, because every time I walk through the door I'm greeted by warm and friendly receptionist. The registration is easy and I've never waited long for my appointment with my Dr...
Dr. Brown has an Excellent bed side manner, He's friendly, Knowledgeable in His expertise and Always shoots from the hip and I appreciate that. Thank You So Much for taking such good care of me and my ❤️ Heart ❣️

resp.text: Thank you for your nice words. Have a Happy and Safe Holiday.

name: Aqualyn K
text: The staff is extremely attentive and very friendly. They are meticulous about being on time, and the quality of care has been excellent. Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We strive to provide high quality care.

name: Jane Fleming
text:
My tela-visit was easy, successful and
I felt that my needs were spoken to,  Dr
Bedwell appears to be unhurried and very patient. He addresses all my concerns.

resp.text: We strive to provide excellent patient care. Thank you for your feedback and positive rating.

name: Chris Berra
text: Dr. Brown is very professional and has always been. He gives advice and explains why I need to follow what he says. He has a great bedside manner and my wife and I trust him implicitly to do what is best for me.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and positive review!

name: Gesa Capers
text: During my visit at Mobile Heart Specialists i was treated with outstanding professionalism from check-in to check-out.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback and positive review!

name: Robert D Reed
text: Dr Brown always gives me the feeling that he does care about me and my health. But all the ladies in the office are as nice as they can be, even dealing with all the people that they have to deal with.

resp.text: Thank you so much for these nice words.

name: J T B
text: I cannot say enough good things about this practice and it’s staff. Dr. Chad Alford is truly an asset to medicine. His medical knowledge, thoughtfulness, concern, and overall patient care strategies show that he genuinely cares about his patients and what is best for them. I would recommend Dr. Alford and this practice to anyone.

name: Carlton Wilson
text: Everyone was courteous and friendly. Very good service. All areas were staffed with professional personnel who made you feel safe and secure.

name: Cohen Holland
text: We have been patients of Dr Alford for years. I had a nuclear stress test yesterday and it went very smoothly.  Robin and Tracy were  considerate and helpful in allowing me time to get on the table for X-ray scans.  Kudos to both of them! I would highly recommend Mobile Heart Specialist to anyone seeking cardiologists in and around Mobile.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share those kind words. Our goal is to provide high quality care, so your feedback is appreciated.

text: Dr Bedwell is a fine doctor his staff is very friendly and helpful rate them a 10 star.

name: Bill Phillips
text:
We love Dr. Chris Brown! He listens! And, he is very kind as well as being a great cardiologist.  We are so happy to have him as our doctor.
Donna and Bill Phillips

text:

A ++

name: Judith Hornady
text: Dr. Noel Bedwell is a great cardiologist. I totally trust him.

name: Jimmy Barnette
text: First time on a phone visit but Dr Noel Bedwell was the ultimate professional he always has been. I love this man like a brother. He took care of my mom the same way. There's not a better heart surgeon in the world. I trust him with my life. Thank you Noel!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback! We strive to provide the best possible care to every patient, and we always enjoy reading about a good experience.

name: Kim Rawson
text: Received great care during cardiac tests from everyone!  Special thanks to Robin who called the day before and explained everything. She also met me there the next morning!

resp.text: We are glad you had a good experience.

name: Brenda K.
text: Dr. Bedwell is clearly one of the best doctors, as evidenced by his ratings.  He is very smart and has a great bedside manner.  Most importantly, I felt safe and relaxed in his care.  The nurse was also great—made me feel comfortable like I was talking to a friend...love that!

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback! We strive to provide the best possible care to every patient, and we always enjoy reading about a good experience.

name: Charles Cook
text: Dr. Chad Alford is arguably the finest cardiologist in Mobile.  He truly has the patient's best interests at heart.  I heartily recommend him.  I might add that the office staff is highly efficient.  I have never encountered a long wait for my appointments.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time out of your day to share those kind words. Our goal is to provide high quality care, so your feedback is appreciated.

text: Top professional Doctors, technicians, nurses and clerical staff who treated me wonderfully. I have been under the care of Mobile Heart Specialists since 2011. I have received the best care and will recommend them to anyone.

name: The Mad Splattr
text: Turned away at the door for being more than 15 minutes late, even though we called ahead and spent about 20 minutes looking for a wheelchair that we were assured were by the entrance (they were not). We drove over an hour to get there only to be turned away, despite us having called ahead to discuss the situation. My grandmother is practically bed bound, yet we managed to get her out.

name: Tim Baldwin
text: Good experience he cares about his patience health

name: Daniel Smith
text: By all means avoid this man. He operated my friend and gave him a stent without anesthesia. And when my friend confronted him about it, the doctor said my bad. No one in the operating room bothered to even acknowledge him in agony when he was screaming and hollering. This is the definition of malfeasant and malpractice. This man should not have a medical license. Avoid him at all costs.

text: Probably the most personable doctor you're going to meet. Very easy to talk to.

name: Deanna Katzl
text: You have the sweetest greeter...she was a big help to me (my first time) but she nearly made me cry helping an elderly lady check in...she was born in the 20s and she drove herself...the greeter offered to follow her home to make sure she got there safe if she was still there when she got off...so sweet...

name: Albert Woods
text: I visited this facility on 10/12/20 for a 10:00 a.m. appointment. I wasn't called to register until 10:30. Had an EKG and B/P checked and waited on the Dr. for 45 minutes before I decided to leave. While I understand this is a Cardio Clinic  and emergencies do arise, communication by the staff  to the patient should be considered.  At the checkout station when I informed the staff why I was leaving, their response was do I want to reschedule.  I should probably be given a credit for not receiving the complete exam.

name: Kyla Sullivan
text:
I had such a terrible experience here. Staff members were so uncompassionate and uncaring, didn't explain anything, and never resolved my problem. I was told that test results were normal and there's no formal follow up.
I did have a good experience with the lady who did my echo. Unlike the others, she explained what she was doing before doing it and was very kind.

resp.text: I'm incredibly sorry to hear that this is how you feel your experience went with our office! While we are a very busy Practice, we absolutely want our patients to feel welcome and taken care of. I would love to hear more if you don't mind reaching out to me personally and explaining. You can reach me on my cell at (256) 945-0598. Rebecca Hedrick / Practice Administrator

name: David Palmer
text:
I just need to know a few things:
Why is patient ignorance so highly valued by your clinic?
Why does your portal  have such little information?
Should the Dr's. notes on a visit in anyway match the remembered experience of the patient?
Should billings tell the patient what services were rendered?

resp.text: Mr. Palmer - I would be happy to discuss these issues with you one on one. You are welcome to reach out to me at (256) 945-0598. That's my personal cell phone. We take a lot of pride in giving out patients above average care and work towards that with anyone willing to work with us in return. I hope to hear from you soon. Rebecca Hedrick / Practice Administrator of Huntsville Cardiovascular Clinic

text: The people are so nice here. They are very respectful especially the doctors and nurses. Dr. Kiessling is the best. She’s very down to earth and friendly. I would and will recommend Huntsville Cardiovascular Center to family and friends

resp.text: Thank you so much for this review Nancy! We pride ourselves on taking the BEST care of our patients. Please let me know if there is anything you need in the future. Rebecca Hedrick / Practice Administrator

name: Matthew Newell
text:
On my first visit, I was left waiting for almost 3 hours! I was supposed to have tests done, but after waiting Dr. Strickland came in and asked why I was there! We talked for less than 5 minutes before he sent me to reschedule.

My second visit was very different than the first. I was called exactly on time. Everyone was helpful and friendly.

resp.text:
Mr. Newell - I am so glad we were able to speak today and that your second experience with our office was to your satisfaction. We definitely work hard to be sure our patients are well taken care of and pleased with our services. I value your input and will work to continue to improve our facility processes.

I hope your evening is GRAND! Please let me know if there is anything I can assist with in the future.
Rebecca Hedrick / Practice Administrator / (256) 213-4660

name: James Lee
text: had a 130 appt. escorted to exam room at 2pm, EKG at 215, then waited to 330 for Dr Strickland..he didn't show so I left.  No one seemed to care when I told them I was leaving and the reason why...

resp.text:
Mr. Lee –
Please accept my apology in taking so long to respond to your review. The truth of the matter is that I, the Administrator for Huntsville Cardiovascular Clinic, had a heart attack in our office 9 days ago. I will forever be grateful for how completely and swiftly my staff and Physicians took care of me. My point in telling you this is to bring to light the fact that our Physicians are often handling VERY delicate life-saving situations that cause them to run late for clinic or just have a hard time fitting everything that must be done into a day.
I am not happy to hear that you felt as if we didn't care that you left. I can personally guarantee that is not the case. We have a reputation in our community of going above and beyond for our patients. One might even say we even spoil them a little. Since Dr. Strickland personally reached out to you (and even gave you his cell phone number), I would hope that you now agree.
I also hope that our actions since your first visit have given you reason to change your 1-star rating. Our success depends on your happiness and we are very aware of that fact.
In the future, please let me know if you are dissatisfied with any service you've received from us. I am more than happy to help!
Rebecca Hedrick / Practice Administrator / 256-945-0598

name: Patsy Morin
text: My wife and I have been satisfied patients of Dr Kelly Smith and the Huntsville Cardiovascular Clinic for many years. Last November we moved my brother to Huntsville from Orlando and immediately requested that he be accepted as a patient there as well.  He has lived these last 7 years with a defibrillator in his chest but has had no regular contact with a cardiologist.  So far he's had several visits to the clinic to establish a file of his current cardiac condition.  One of those visits (3/16/17) determined that his defibrillator battery had to be replaced, so an appointment was set up for 3/24/17 at Crestwood Hospital.  That date had to be rescheduled to 4/6/17 at 9AM.  We showed up at 8:40AM only to be told that the doctor was stuck by weather in Minnesota.  No phone call preventing us from making the trip to the hospital!  The procedure was rescheduled for 4/10/17 at 10AM. We showed up at 9:40AM and began our wait.  My brother was taken back soon after arrival and prepped for his procedure but his waiting room tracking code never appeared on the monitor.  I began to ask questions around noon without success.  No one could tell us what was going on.  The doctor finally showed up around 4PM and my brother, who'd had nothing to eat all day finally made it home at 8PM.  Not one phone call from anyone!!! Unsat!

name: Kathy Harkleroad
text: I've been a patient of Dr. Kelly Smith for as long as I can remember. I love his professionalism, how he welcomes questions and is very reassuring in his answers. I've been the rounds in this office and have had a stress test, nuclear medicine, ekg's, echos, you name it. Each time Dr. Smith was on top of everything and told me what the results were immediately. When I had a problem with my high blood pressure, he and his nurse April were quick to answer phone calls and worked with me on adjusting my meds to get it lowered. I could not ask for a better cardiologist and recommend him highly to anyone!

resp.text: Thank you SO MUCH for the highest rating and very kind words!!!! We work really hard to take the best care of our patients. Please let me know if there is ever anything I can do for you. Rebecca Hedrick / Practice Administrator / 256-880-1050

name: robin chaney
text: Sent my grandma to the hospital and literally absolutely nothing was wrong with her!! 88 years old and sat in the ER for 9 hours till 11 pm. Worst doctor ever! He's a cardio Dr and couldn't even do his job. He gave her a panic attack at 88 years old!!

We pride ourselves in, and are very known in the community for, being above average in our patient care and satisfaction. I would be happy to sit down with you face to face or have a phone conversation with you regarding your account if you would allow it.
Rebecca Hedrick / Practice Administrator / (256) 880-1050
UPDATE: I was very happy to help clear things up and appreciate the feedback! Please let me know if you need anything in the future.
